meanings.sent1: She misrefers the date of the meeting in her email.
meanings.sent2: He often misrefers to historical events in his speeches.
meanings.sent3: The detective misrefers the suspect's alibi, causing confusion.
meanings.sent4: Her compass misrefers north, leading her off course.
meanings.sent5: The student's misrefers in the essay were easily corrected with feedback.

meanings.definition: To make a reference that is mistaken or misleading.
meanings.sent1: The unreliable website misrefers important facts.
meanings.sent2: Politicians sometimes misrefers statistics to support their arguments.
meanings.sent3: The comedian misrefers a famous quote, creating a hilarious mix-up.
meanings.sent4: His memory misrefers the details of the event, distorting the truth.
meanings.sent5: The faulty map misrefers the location of the hidden treasure.
